granted so we need our grassroots supporters to step up so our great candidates have a fighting chance before saturdayâ s deadline will you pitch in or more to help elect democrats linksi know democrats can count on you name all the best amyamy k daceychief executive officerdemocratic national committeeâ v rae â friend remember a couple months ago when we were welcoming in the new year if your answer to that is â sure vaguelyâ â well that makes two of us name we are state primaries and caucuses in to just days away from our convention in philadelphia and only a little over six months away from the day we elect our next democratic president of the united states lt link gt but before then weâ re facing major deadlines like the one coming up this saturday your donation of or whatever you can today helps prepare us for those rapidly approaching days ahead of us lt link gt those are some pretty big countdowns ahead of us name every last day leading up to these milestones matter tremendously and iâ m hoping that youâ ll help us keep up the momentum we need to win starting with our deadline this saturday linksi know we ask a lot of you name and i want you to know how much i appreciate your support this year is moving fast and we canâ t let any opportunity to support democrats pass us by all the best amyamy k daceychief executive officerdemocratic national committeeâ v more than i can say name no matter how you choose to get engaged with the democratic party and our amazing candidates both at the presidential level and down the ticket in all states we re so glad that you re on the team because at the end of the day we all know that we simply can t allow a president trump to replace barack obama in the white house and to stop that from happening we ve all got to work together harder than we ever have before i know we can do it but we need to dig deep that s why today i m asking you to step up donors again and pitch in or whatever you can before saturday s end of month deadline linkswith another democrat in the white house and a democratic congress to back him or her up we re not just going to protect president obama s progress we re going to build on hi all â a few emails from the president to send later this week let me know if you have any flags and thanks â v ejb election day is now less than six months away name republicans have their presumptive nominee and are going to have to start asking themselves some hard questions whether this nominee really speaks for them and represents their values whether this nominee is really someone who can lead a country that is only growing more diverse let me be clear â we live in serious times and this is a serious job over the next few months it is imperative that we remember â and remind our friends and neighbors â that this is not entertainment this is not a reality show this is a contest for president of the united states and all of the responsibilities of that office thatâ s why iâ m going to do everything i can between today and november th to make sure a democrat succeeds me in office too much is at stake not to take this race as seriously as we ever have and i hope youâ re as committed as i am to making sure we win this linkwe canâ t do this without you name i really mean that thank you for standing with us barack obamaâ v rae â friend â one of the things iâ ll be proudest of when i leave this office is that we didnâ t limit ourselves to addressing only the problems that affect us personally whether it was ensuring that young people could graduate from college without the burden of debt to protecting health care for those with serious medical conditions to setting the wheels in motion to protect our planet for generations to come we rallied together not just for ourselves but for our fellow americans and we know that that our country is stronger because of it so at this particular time in this election i look to folks like you name and want to say two things thank you for everything youâ ve done so far and letâ s do everything we can to ensure that our next president will continue to fight for every american linkthank you name barack obama v sk friend for the past four decades democratic leadership in the white hosue has made our country great by strengthening our economy producing jobs and reducing our deficit meanwhile republican administrations have been marked by lowering taxes for the wealthiest among us and cutting vital government programs and services that hardworking american families rely on that s just history so yes the republicans now have a presumptive nominee but the truth is there really is nothing new about what the republican party believes they still deny that climate change is real they still want to take away a woman s right to choose and they still seek to repeal obamacare and reverse all of the progress we ve made together so really name our decision in this election is pretty easy we can do everything we can to make sure our next president is a democrat who will keep our country moving forward or we can let the republicans put someone in office who won t you can count on me to do whatever i can to help elect democrats up and down the ballot in november name add your name if i can count on you to do the same linkthanks for your help name barack obama

the vast majority of those voters aren t actually new to voting or to the republican party but rather they are reliable past voters in general elections in iowa republican caucus turnout smashed its sub: Exit Polls Continue to Show Democratic Unity
body: this democratic enthusiasm is not only found in new york see tonight s contests these numbers are further evidence that republicans are being torn apart by divisive candidates and an ugly primary process democratic voters are proud of their candidates and it shows every time they go to the polls across the country whether they vote for senator sanders or secretary clinton democrats are expressing their support for a candidate they respect and admire and will come together for whomever is the nominee in november

sub: Last chance to refer a friend and win an Apple watch!
body: referrals are a win win refer a friend colleague or business partner to the national association of politicalfundraisers and be entered in a drawing to win an apple watch if your referral joins napf as a member he or she is entered in the drawing too drawing takes place may join the national association of political fundraisers today one lucky member willwin an apple watch here s how it works forward this email to your professional contacts fellow fundraisers serviceproviders and co workers click on the start here button to join the national association of politicalfundraisers as a member have your referral enter your name in the referred by box on the checkout pageto be automatically entered in a drawing for an apple watch if your referral joins napf during the month of may he or she is enteredin the drawing as well the more referrals you generate the more times you are entered in the drawing start referring today the national association of political fundraisers napf was formed with a bipartisanboard of directors and provides a forum for leaders owners and staff of politicalfundraising firms to network and grow as an industry our goal is for napf to attractfundraising professionals from across the country to provide opportunities for networking business development continuing education and information on key industry issues to see membership levels and benefits valid for new member enrollment only enrollments created by existing members willnot qualify for this promotion referred friends must join napf as members betweenapril and april and enter a name into the referred by box to qualify for the promotion all other membership and promotional rules apply follow us on social media for the latest membership news and events national association of political fundraisers is a c not for profit organization contributions are not tax deductible as charitable contributions for income tax purposes members may claim a percentage of membership dues as a business expensededuction napf will provide information annually regarding the percentage of membershipdues that are tax deductible tax id this email was sent to kaplanj dnc org by jwhitefield napf us update profile email addressinstant removal with safeunsubscribe tm privacy policy online marketing byconstant contact r www constantcontact comnational association of political fundraisers n broadway ada ok

sub: Koch network reserves $30 million in Senate ad buys
body: koch network reserves million in senate ad buysby kenneth p vogel am edtkey groups in the koch brothers political network on monday began reserving million in advertising buys in key senate races in august and september a network official tells politico the television and digital ad buys from freedom partners action fund and other groups are expected to target democratic senate candidates or boost republican ones in florida nevada ohio and pennsylvania the official said the ad reservations come on the same day that national review reported that the brothers network which had intended to spend million in the run up to the elections was scaling back its political involvement in the face of disappointing results and concerns about damage to the brothers multinational industrial conglomerate koch industries the story caused a major buzz in republican finance circles with some fundraisers predicting that donors would reduce their giving to the koch network in favor of other groups promising a more politically aggressive approach to spending but the network official said that the buys were unrelated to the story downplayed its central thesis and signaled support for the gop senate majority the network is and will continue to be fully engaged in political and policy battles said the official who requested anonymity we want to maximize the number of freedom oriented senators in terms of free speech in particular the current majority is preferable to the alternative the official pointed out that freedom partners action fund and other groups in the network have has already spent more than million on ads in key senate races asserting that was more than any other outside group on tuesday morning the super pac launched a million television and digital targeting former ohio gov ted strickland s senate campaign and the official said that other core groups in the koch network americans for prosperity the libre initiative and generation opportunity grew their field staffs by percent last year and had made twice as many voter contacts at this point in the cycle than at a comparable point in the cycle to view online

sub: POLITICO Huddle: TIME RUNNING OUT FOR HILL ON PUERTO RICO â€” Pelosiâ€™s own Puerto Rico conundrum â€” OBAMA TAKES GARLAND PLEA TO REPORTERS FROM SENATE BATTLEGROUND STATES, WITH STRINGS â€” â€œDummy politiciansâ€ â€” A BUSY HILL DEPARTURE LOUNGE.
body: am edtby rachael bade rbade politico com or rachaelmbade with help from burgess everett time running for lawmakers to act on puerto rico your huddle author and politico pro financial services reporter colin wilhelm the island began defaulting on most of a million debt payment sunday at midnight but much bigger problems are just around the corner congress has just a handful of weeks to hammer out a legislative fix to save the island from financial ruin ahead of a second default on a billion debt payment due in early july but while gop congressional staff is working through the break to sketch out a plan b with an eye towards unveiling it around may getting a fix off the ground before july could be a major lift pelosi s big puerto rico problem huddle still contends this is a waaaay bigger issue for speaker paul ryan than it is for minority leader nancy pelosi but the hill s mike lillis and peter schroeder have a fresh democratic angle on this the democratic leader aimed piercing criticism at republicans on friday for inaction on a host of issues as varied as the zika crisis and the national budget then adopted an entirely different tone regarding puerto rico s debt crisis i think they re operating in good faith she said obama takes garland plea to senate battleground states hanna trudo reports for politico president barack obama praised supreme court nominee judge merrick garland on monday while urging congressional republicans again to grant him a hearing and vote spoke to outlets from states with republican senate incumbents iowa chuck grassley new hampshire kelly ayotte ohio rob portman wisconsin ron johnson arizona john mccain and missouri roy blunt about what he described as an unprecedented process i know that folks like sen ayotte met with him and the fact that they re not calling for a hearing or a vote means they re not doing their job he said about ayotte who smajority leader mitch mcconnell s longtime press guy and lover of dogs don stewart was all over this on twitter last night local affiliates brought in to interview potus today had to ask at least one question about the scotus nominee he tweeted then again wait you mean the president s scotus nominee isn t leading the news outside the beltway i m shocked what does it mean that the white house had to require local tv stations to ask about his scotus nominee in order to interview potus good tuesday morning it s may and thanks for reading huddle where it s lots of meetings during recess and not a whole lot else i m always reachable via email at rbade politico com or on the twitters rachaelmbadetoday in congress recess around the hill a lot of nothing whoops dem club loses liquor license capitol hill democrats had a bit of a booze problem last weekend and no we re not talking about the hangovers post white house correspondents dinner parties little birdie told my colleague anna palmer the national democratic club the lawmaker restaurant on capitol hill next to democratic national committee headquarters had shuttered its bar removed the alcohol from cupboards and taped everything off turns out the restaurant forgot to extend its liquor license and was operating without the proper paperwork for several hours last friday tsk tsk all fixed now a busy hill departure lounge longtime house rules committee staff director for the dems miles lackey is leaving the hill at the end of the month just about every member of democratic leadership put out a statement wishing him well here s whip steny hoyer during his years of public service miles has been instrumental in the passage of numerous key pieces of legislation including the affordable care act don sisson is now taking over having been on the panel for more than a decade before becoming special assistant to the president for legislative affairs at the white house on the other side of the capitol campus sen debbie stabenow picked up miranda margowsky to be her new press secretary and ian wilhite as her deputy margowsky comes from the house democratic caucus chairman xavier becerra s office wilhite was a senior consultant for public affairs at fti consulting haley dorgan also just joined sen jeanne shaheen s office as press secretary leaving sunshine sachs coms director ryan nickel writes of her her favorite color is black her favorite activity is karaoke her favorite food is tzatziki her favorite book is all the light we cannot see and the tv show she s hooked on right now is broad city and there s been lots of action on the comms side for sen jerry moran this week with katie niederee promoted to communications director jordan langdon is coming onboard deputy communications director and carter baum becomes press secretary langdon comes over from rep jeff denham s office monday s trivia winner kirtan mehta was the first to answer that there are three additional robert emmet statuses in dublin san francisco and emmetsburg iowa today s trivia comes from our winner in honor of indiana s primary indiana has been a very reliably republican state in the general election only going to democrats twice since in fact in two elections since it was an island of red with no border being touched by a single other red state name those years email me rbade politico com to view online

sub: Re: Nordic Leaders State Dinner Request from DWS
body: ha ha awesome jordan kaplan national finance directordemocratic national committee o c kaplanj dnc org gt gt amazing gt gt from mahoney caitria l eop who gt gt gt gt from dyer deesha mailto deesha dyer who eop gov gt gt unfortunately we can t it s really too late with vetting gt gt gt gt from hicks delgado tequia gt gt gt gt any way we can get this debbie wasserman schultz ask into the nordic dinner friday here s her rationale bio for this invite no guest she says he is a major supporter and helped us a lot on the iran vote gt gt gt gt mitchell berger has been involved at a significant level in national and florida state politics and policy on behalf of the democratic party since a field director for jimmy carter in eastern pennsylvania in the campaign mr berger went on to work for the carter administration in the department of transportation during the clinton administration mr berger had positions with the small business advisory council the environmental finance advisory board and as chairman of the board of sallie mae at salle mae mr berger led the efforts to privatize the government sponsored enterprise mr berger also served as the chair of the federal victory fund for the dnc for the presidential election he was also one of the lead lawyers representing vice president gore and senator joe lieberman in the cases commonly known as bush v gore mr berger co chaired the battleground victory fund for kerry edwards and was a significant contributor to the financial and election protection efforts in both obama biden campaigns he is amongst the national leaders in secretary clinton s fundraising efforts and is serving as an advisor for environmental outreach for her campaign on a state level mr berger has served as the florida democratic party s finance chair on several occasions and has served on the state s environmental regulation commission and the south florida water management district the lead state agency with responsibility for everglades restoration gt gt gt

sub: DNC Chair Statement on Tonightâ€™s Primary Results
body: for immediate releaseapril contact dnc press â lt tel gt dnc chair statement on tonightâ s primary resultswashington tonight voters went to the polls in five states in pennsylvania exit polling showed that percent of democratic voters felt their primary had energized the party while percent of republican voters said their primary had divided the party â nearly the same in both cases as what new yorkers reported last week dnc chair debbie wasserman schultz issued the following statement on tonightâ s results â ranting and raving his way to five primary victories tonight donald trump has secured his chokehold on the republican nomination for years gop leaders have pushed a cynical and feckless political strategy that exploits unfounded fears of immigrants minorities the poor the lgbt community and more all for political gain they have sold hardworking americans the empty promise of trickle down prosperity while strangling americaâ s middle class with backwards economic policies that only enrich those already at the top donald trumpâ s impending nomination is the ultimate sad culmination of the success of that strategy trump is the modern republican party â itâ s no surprise that at exit polls in contest after contest more and more democratic voters are reporting that our primary process has energized our party while more and more republicans report deep dispiriting divisions in theirs â i want to congratulate both of our candidates for continuing to run spirited substantive campaigns worthy of the american people itâ s clear that when we get through our conventions democrats will emerge united having nominated the next president while the gop will have to wallow in the chaotic mess of their own making â

hi all primaries are being held in kentucky and oregon today and we wanted to share with you and your teams some topline information on their delegate selection processes on our side there are pledged delegates up for grabs today below please find a brief summary of the process attached you will find the internal fact sheets for kentucky and oregon as always please let us know if you have any questions kentucky primary polls open at am edt cdt and close at pm edt cdt there are a total of pledged delegates that will be allocated proportionally based on tuesday s results a percent threshold is required in order for a presidential contender to received pledged delegates at either the congressional district or statewide level the delegate breakdown is district level delegatespleo delegatesat large delegatesin addition to the pledged delegates there are unpledged delegates from kentucky republican processall of kentucky s delegates to the republican national convention are bound to presidential contenders based on the results of the voting in the march kentucky presidential caucuses the delegates to the national convention are to be allocated proportionally among those candidates receiving or more of the statewide caucus vote the proportional delegate allocation shall be rounded to the nearest whole delegate in the event that a delegate is unallocated due to mathematical rounding the unallocated delegate vote shall be cast in favor of the candidate closest to the rounding threshold in the event that delegates are over allocated due to mathematical rounding the over allocated delegate shall be removed from the candidate furthest from the rounding threshold oregon primary oregon is vote by mail ballots must be received by pm pdt election day democratic processthere are a total of pledged delegates that will be allocated proportionally based on today s results a percent threshold is required in order for a presidential contender to received pledged delegates at either the congressional district or statewide level the delegate breakdown is district level delegatespleo delegatesat large delegatesdistrict level delegates are allocated based on the results in each congressional district the pleo and at large delegates are allocated based on the statewide results in addition to the pledged delegates there are unpledged delegates from oregon republican processall of oregon s delegates to the republican national convention are allocated to presidential contenders based on the results of the voting in today s presidential primary district at large bonus plus party leader delegates to the national convention are to be bound to presidential contenders based on the primary vote statewide the party leaders the national committeeman the national committeewoman and the chairman of the oregon s republican party will attend the convention as bound delegates by virtue of their position this is a vote by mail primary state election officials will be mailing ballots out to registered voters before the election the voter has until pm local time on the date of the primary to return the completed ballot to either the county election office or a designated drop site postmarks do not count

sub: RE: IDEA FOR THE CONVENTION -- Sen. Gillibrand and Ahmad and George Clooney - TImely!
body: oh calm dowwwnnnnn i just sent something claire jordan kaplannational finance directordemocratic national committee o c kaplanj dnc org lt mailto kaplanj dnc org gt cid image png d b de e d it sounds like she really wants to talk to youâ â â also can you just respond jordan kaplannational finance directordemocratic national committee o c kaplanj dnc org lt mailto kaplanj dnc org gt lt image png gt did you reply to this this cracks me up jordan timely carol p and i were ready to send this draft letter below to senator gillibrand tomorrow asking her and her organization off the sidelines to cohost an event with wlf at the convention however i had also reached out last week to jae kim a friend of mine and former wlf member now living in vancouver if she would feel comfortable contacting her best friend ahmal clooney to see if she might be part of this event jae called me today to say that she spoke to ahmal that george has been invited to speak at convention hasn t accepted yet but he s thinking it s too important not to and that if he accepts the speaking role they would both consider being our special guests at this event great news they also met kirsten are impressed with her and would like to do something together with her jae is aware of wlf s importance at the convention doesn t want emily and emerge to steal all the limelight and conveyed info about wlf to the clooneys clooneys have asked for a fact sheet about the potential event to be emailed to their personal assistant next week jae will send me contact info we need your help right away jordan to carry this event idea further to the dnc to inform dws get her ok etc note we feel it s important that event be co hosted by wlf not the women s caucus or debbie s umbrella women s organization though all should be invited and welcome at this reception i will amend my email to kirsten tomorrow to include the outreach and possibility of the clooneys coming on board also lottie shackleford she contacted carol and me originally about planning an event i would like to bring her into planning stage soon as we get sign off from you what else thanks jordan this would be a high profile event for all women at the convention and on tv call me if you wish including over the weekend cynthia cell sent from my iphonebegin forwarded message date may at pm edtdraftcarol here s my draft for our letter to kirsten please review edit chop etc i d like to finalize it this weekend so we email it to kirsten sunday night before the beginning of the week sets in cc emily and stefaniehello kirsten i hope all s well with you even throughout this tumultuous political landscape carol pensky and i both send you warm personal wishes with this email carol and i spoke with the dnc this week concerning ideas for wlf s presence at the july convention we all agreed how important it is that wlf dwa and ots are highlighted there though not thru a fundraising event if your plans are still open we would like to propose holding a joint event with ots and wlf a festive reception to be underwritten by a woman s magazine or other sponsor tuesday afternoon july th pm we would focus on you as the special star attraction of the event the idea made great sense to us since you are the member of congress who has done the absolute most for democratic women candidates the past several cycles the event would give you a platform to highlight your efforts as well as include a wlf message pointing out the importance of women s involvement in the election processes and serving as the women s host for the dnc fyi two organizations emerge and emily s list will hold gatherings that week emerge on tuesday pm and emily s list on wednesday pm please note that we have both taken a special friend advantage by contacting you directly indeed you are a special friend and it will be followed up by the official dnc chair s invitation after our informal exploration of the idea we hope this plan holds a mgreat appeal to you as well and we look forward to hearing from you with best wishes cynthia and carol

i have called and texted karen ten times since october of last year sent from my iphonehey andy attached is the list of donors for your region who have maxed the past few years but have yet to max this year as we discussed on the vice chair call today we would like the vice chairs to go through these lists and see if there are people you are willing to contact we can make call sheets for the people you would like to call if thatâ s preferable let me know if you have any questions thanks alexalex hoffmandemocratic national committeedeputy chief of staff for finance hoffmana dnc org lt mailto hoffmana dnc org gt south capitol street se washington dc lt image png gt

sub: POLITICO's Morning Defense, presented by BAE Systems: U.S. sails warship in disputed South China Sea â€” U.S., Russia agree to restore Syrian cease-fire â€” Kendall talks acquisition today
body: by jeremy herb am edtwith louis nelson and connor o brienbreaking overnight u s sails warship near disputed reef in south china sea reports reuters a u s navy warship sailed close to a disputed reef in the south china sea on tuesday a u s department of defense official said prompting anger in beijing which denounced the patrol as illegal and a threat to peace and stability guided missile destroyer the uss william p lawrence traveled within nautical miles of chinese occupied fiery cross reef defense department spokesman bill urban said the so called freedom of navigation operation was undertaken to challenge excessive maritime claims by china taiwan and vietnam which were seeking to restrict navigation rights in the south china sea he said if at first you don t succeed u s russia agree to restore syrian cease fire the wall street journal s felicia schwartz writes from paris secretary of state john kerry said monday that the u s and russia have agreed to work to restore a nationwide cease fire in syria but cautioned it would be up to actors on the ground to ensure it holds mr kerry spoke to reporters after meeting in paris with a top syrian opposition official and with foreign ministers from saudi arabia france turkey germany jordan qatar and the united arab emirates he said the proof of monday s agreement the latest in a flurry of diplomacy between russia and the u s to calm the violence in syria will be in the eating of the pudding not the making mr kerry spoke by phone monday with russian foreign minister sergei lavrov before issuing a joint statement saying the powers would intensify efforts to implement the nationwide cease fire but aleppo fighting still rages reports reuters syrian government forces and their allies fought insurgents near aleppo on monday and jets conducted raids around a nearby town seized by islamist rebels a monitoring group said as syria s military said a ceasefire in aleppo would be extended by hours starting on tuesday a recent surge in bloodshed in aleppo syria s largest city before the war wrecked the week old partial truce sponsored by washington and moscow that had allowed u n brokered peace talks to convene in geneva syria s military high command was quoted by state news agency sana as saying the aleppo ceasefire would be extended by hours in the northern city beginning at a m local time on tuesday a number of short term local truces have been in place since april first around damascus and northern latakia and then in aleppo but there has still been fighting between rebels and government forces defense bills today sasc subcommittee markups house appropriations releases defense bill text the senate armed services committee holds its five remaining subcommittee markups for the national defense authorization act a legislative appetizer ahead of the main event the full committee markup that begins wednesday only three of the five subcommittee markups today will be open the full committee debate where anything controversial is discussed will be closed the house defense appropriations subcommittee also releases its bill text today likely around p m the time of wednesday s closed subcommittee markup the bill will include boosted base funding from the overseas operations contingency budget a congressional aide tells morning d as the house armed services committee did in the defense authorization measure worth noting the bill text will include legislative policies for the committee but the funding tables won t be released until the day before the full committee markup which won t be until next week at the earliest happy tuesday and welcome to morning defense where we ve had enough playoff overtimes keep the tips pitches and feedback coming at jherb politico com and follow on twitter jeremyherb morningdefense and politicopro happening today obama convenes isil meeting president barack obama convenes his national security council this morning at the white house for an update on the campaign against the islamic state also today kendall talks acquisition chief pentagon weapons buyer frank kendall talks about the state of defense acquisition this morning at a discussion hosted by the center for strategic and international studies watch survey says troops prefer trump to hillary via military times in a new survey of american military personnel donald trump emerged as active duty service members preference to become the next u s president topping hillary clinton by more than a to margin however in the latest military times election survey more than one in five troops said they d rather not vote in november if they have to choose between just those two candidates but given only those choices percent of the service members surveyed said they would abstain from voting more than percent of the troops military times surveyed said they would vote for trump the presumed republican presidential nominee over clinton the democratic front runner only about percent said they would vote for clinton in that matchup the results while not a scientific sampling of military voting patterns show strong support for trump among troops despite critics attacks that he lacks foreign policy or national security experience but but but the caveats the sample is not a perfect representation of the military as a whole it over represents officers and noncommissioned officers and under represents junior enlisted personnel however it is representative of the more senior and career oriented members of the force who run the military s day to day operations and carry out its policies the voluntary nature of this survey the dependence on email and the characteristics of military times readers may affect the results a message from bae systems at bae systems our amphibious combat vehicles are designed from the ground up to meet the amphibious mission with demonstrated ship to objective maneuver capability with our proven systems we help get marines to the mission and bring them back learn more at www baesystems com sas space wars rise of spacex fuels pentagon second guessing our colleague matthew nussbaum takes the long view on the spacex united launch alliance feud ten years ago when the pentagon went looking for a reliable means of getting spy satellites and other hardware into space it had a choice between lockheed martin and boeing but instead of making the bitterly competitive engineering giants compete for the lucrative contracts it gave the deal to both of them creating a hybrid called the united launch alliance the unusual joint venture sounded alarm bells at the ftc which warned of the risks of such a monopoly costs would rise without competition and innovation would be stifled the pentagon steamrolled that criticism assured access to space as defense officials put it was a matter of national security now years after ula was born the ftc s direst warnings have come true along with outcomes even the skeptics did not predict ula has conducted space launches all but flawlessly but the per launch cost is more than million according to the government accountability office even as cheaper alternatives have become available meanwhile ula which has received roughly billion national security dollars since which includes an approximately million annual retainer is under investigation by the pentagon for possible corrupt bidding practices and is preparing to lay off percent of its workforce its long term viability is in doubt for your radar ndaa amendment would remove provision requiring women register for draft the house rules committee chairman has filed an amendment to the national defense authorization act that would remove a provision requiring women register for the draft the amendment from republican rep pete sessions of texas would strike a provision from the bill added by rep duncan hunter during the house armed services committee markup which required that women to register for the selective service but sessions amendment likely to be considered when the bill goes to the floor next week was not added to push back against hunter in fact the amendment has the california republican s blessing said hunter chief of staff joe kasper that s because hunter opposes his own amendment war report senior islamic state official killed in airstrike in iraq via the washington post one of the islamic state s top leaders in iraq s anbar province was killed in a u s airstrike last week the pentagon said monday abu wahib the military emir of anbar and three other islamic state members were killed may while traveling in a vehicle near the town of rutbah in western iraq pentagon press secretary peter cook said the youngest kim gets a new title chairman writes the los angeles times to cheers of long life north korean ruler kim jong un received the new title of chairman of the workers party of korea on monday formally bolstering his status â years after he came to power following the death of his father kim jong il kim jong un previously held several top titles including general in the korean people s army member of the party central committee and vice chairman of the party central military commission document drawer u s effort in syria the center for a new american security is releasing a new report this morning on the u s role to de escalate the civil war in syria the report argues the u s primary effort there should focus on a bottom up strategy for building cohesive moderate armed opposition institutions with a regional focus that is tailored for each individual region within syria speed read at a parade celebrating russia s victory in world war ii president vladimir putin launches veiled criticism at the u s and its stance in syria the new york times a shiite cleric who first made his name fighting u s forces in is again roiling iraq s political order the associated press a former north korean military chief who south korea said had been executed is actually alive and now has several new senior posts ap a suicide bombing near baghdad kills at least ap jordan s strong intelligence and security forces have allowed it to launch particularly successful operations both covert and overt against the islamic state defense news the team of u s troops currently deployed in yemen will remain there without a firm end date but a pentagon spokesman says their stay there remains short term military times the pentagon is developing ways to protect its exposed national security satellites in space from potential hostile action the washington post a message from bae systems at bae systems we work relentlessly to stay ahead of any challenge our customers may face our passion and dedication shows in everything we do from advanced electronic systems to cyber operations and intelligence analysis from combat vehicles and naval weapons and from ship maintenance and modernization to vehicle upgrades and services knowing that our work makes a difference inspires us to push ourselves and the technologies we create to new levels that s bae systems that s inspired work learn more about our technologies systems and services at www baesystems com us to view online

sub: FW: The time to act is now -- join me May 31st
body: this is a good onehillary is a st class doosh you and her can kmasent from my iphone image removed by sender democrats friend donald trump is the presumptive republican nominee for president of the united states in as a lifelong advocate for women s rights this statement is frightening to me donald trump has pledged to reverse the vast amounts of great progress we have made over the years his demeaning treatment of women and his stance on the supreme court and issues such as abortion would reverse this progress this negatively impacts millions of americans across the country and that is unacceptable please help us support democrats up and down the ticket to stop the republicans advance the time to act is now that is why i hope you will join me robbie kaplan and special guest tina tchen for a democratic national committee dinner at pm on may st at the home of laetitia and richard garriott in new york we will come together and discuss the upcoming race and why we as democrats must do everything we can to ensure a democrat remains in the white house for the next four years rsvp now below i hope you will answer this important call to action gloria allredwomen s rights attorneypaid for by the democratic national committee south capitol street se washington dc and not authorized by any candidate or candidate s committee contributions or gifts to the democratic national committee are not tax deductible

a federal court upheld virginia s voter id law dpva has already issued a statement the story is below i m reviewing the decision now a federal judge has upheld virginiaâ s voter id law challenged by the democratic party of virginia and two voters alleging the republican controlled state legislature enacted it to curb the number of young and minority voters â mindful that the courtâ s mission is to judge not the wisdom of the virginia voter id law but rather its constitutionality this court cannot say that plaintiffs have met their burden of proof in showing by a preponderance of the evidence that the virginia voter id law â contravenes the voting rights act the first amendment the fourteenth amendment the fifteenth amendment or the twenty sixth amendment â u s district judge henry e hudson wrote thursday sent from my iphone
let me know if you have any editsalex shapiromid atlantic amp pac finance directordemocratic national committee o c shapiroa dnc org lt mailto shapiroa dnc org gt

body: good can i just get the landing page for v jacquelyn lopez perkins coie llpassociate thirteenth street n w suite washington dc d f e jacquelynlopez perkinscoie com lt mailto jacquelynlopez great democrats up and down the ballot in all states it s a big job but i know we have what it takes to get it done because we have supporters like you name donorsyou ve already chipped in xx so far during this election and i can t thank you enough for that it s what helps us keep the lights turned on around here yes but it also builds the war chest we ll need to face the republicans and puts democrats in the best possible position to win in november now is the time when we need everyone to dig a little deeper to help us cross that finish line and we re counting on grassroots supporters like you to help us get there we have a big deadline coming up on saturday name can i count on you to step up again and chip in or more right now linksnondonorsdonations from grassroots supporters like you are what help us keep the lights turned on around here yes but they also build the war chest we ll need to face the republicans and put democrats in the best possible position to win in november now is the time when we need everyone to dig a little deeper to help us cross that finish line and we re counting on folks like you to help us get there we have a big deadline coming up on saturday name can i count on you to chip in or more right now linksthank you so much for everything you do all the best amyamy k daceychief executive officerdemocratic national committee v sk we re just over six months from election day name lt link gt that means we ve got less than days to give democratic candidates up and down the ballot the resources they ll need to build winning campaigns and defeat their republican opponents in november lt link gt we still have a few more caucuses and primaries between now and our convention in july but we already know this whether it s hillary clinton or bernie sanders who wins the primary our nominee needs to be ready to hit the ground running to beat whoever the republicans nominate donorsand name the xx that you ve chipped in so far this election is going to help us keep a republican out of the white house but the stakes are too high to take even one of these days between now and november th for granted and we need our best grassroots supporters people like you to keep stepping up so our great candidates have a fighting chance before saturday s deadline will you pitch in or more one more time to help elect democrats linksnondonorsand name the stakes are too high to take even one of these days between now and november th for granted so we need our grassroots supporters to step up so our great candidates have a fighting chance before saturday s deadline will you pitch in or more to help elect democrats linksi know democrats can count on you name all the best amyamy k daceychief executive officerdemocratic national committee v rae friend remember a couple months ago when we were welcoming in the new year if your answer to that is sure vaguely well that makes two of us name we are state primaries and caucuses in to just days away from our convention in philadelphia and only a little over six months away from the day we elect our next democratic president of the united states lt link gt but before then we re facing major deadlines like the one coming up this saturday your donation of or whatever you can today helps prepare us for those rapidly approaching days ahead of us lt link gt those are some pretty big countdowns ahead of us name every last day leading up to these milestones matter tremendously and i m hoping that you ll help us keep up the momentum we need to win starting with our deadline this saturday linksi know we ask a lot of you name and i want you to know how much i appreciate your support this year is moving fast and we can t let any opportunity to support democrats pass us by all the best amyamy k daceychief executive officerdemocratic national committee v jgr friend we re less than days from our convention a little over six months from election day and we ve had state primaries and caucuses so far so i wanted to take a minute to let you know where things stand here s how you ve been a part of our efforts so far this election non actiontakersemail subscriber yes we re glad to have you here online action taker no lt link gt if you want to let us know you re standing with democrats click here lt link gt election donor not yetnondonorsemail subscriber yes we re glad to have you here online action taker yep thanks for showing your support for democrats election donor not yetdonorsemail subscriber yes we re glad to have you here online action taker yep thanks for showing your support for democrats election donor yes and we appreciate it more than i can say name no matter how you choose to get engaged with the democratic party and our amazing candidates both at the presidential level and down the ticket in all states we re so glad that you re on the team because at the end of the day we all know that we simply can t allow a president trump to replace barack obama in the white house and to stop that from happening we ve all got to work together harder than we ever have before i know we can do it but we need to dig deep that s why today i m asking you to step up donors again and pitch in or whatever you can before saturday s end of month deadline linkswith another democrat in the white house and a democratic congress to back him or her up we re not just going to protect president obama s progress we re going to build on it so that generations of americans to come have a fair shot to succeed thank you for everything you do all the best amyamy k daceychief executive officerdemocratic national committee jessalyn reiddeputy email directordemocratic national committeereidj dnc org lt mailto reidj dnc org sub: BREAKING NEWS: Trump wins Nebraska Republican primary
body: donald trump has won the nebraska republican primary according to three separate news networks despite being the only republican candidate left in the race after ted cruz and john kasich both suspended their campaigns last week trump kept up his pace on the campaign trail before traveling to the pacific northwest states of oregon and washington trump stopped over in omaha last friday night trump s victory in the state comes despite fierce opposition from freshman sen ben sasse one of the first republicans to come out against the party s presumptive nominee nebraska awards its delegates on a winner take all basis

sub: 2016 Nerdcast: Is Trump really making nice with the GOP?
body: nerdcast is trump really making nice with the gop by kristin roberts kenneth p vogel eli stokols charlie mahtesian and scott bland am edtit s time for episode of the nerdcast politico s new podcast on the race for the white house tune in each week to geek out with us as we dive deep into this amazing presidential race the latest numbers that actually matter plus backstage dope on how politics really works we re the kind of folks who like to spend our friday nights poring over poll numbers or the latest federal election commission reports so if you want to understand how the modern politics game is played this is the podcast for you subscribe to the nerdcast on itunes or download from soundcloud here in this week s episode national editor kristin roberts senior investigative reporter ken vogel senior political correspondent eli stokols senior politics editor charlie mahtesian and campaigns editor scott bland discuss donald trump s fraught relations with the republican national committee and his calculations about picking a running mate hillary clinton s inability to put away bernie sanders and the polls that may or may not show a general election race that s tighter than anyone thought feedback what should we talk about next email us at nerdcast politico com podcast produced by matthew sobocinski to view online

sub: Indiana Democratic Party Statement on Mike Penceâ€™s Endorsement of Ted Cruz
body: for immediate releaseapril contact dnc press â indiana democratic party statement on mike penceâ s endorsement of ted cruzâ mike penceâ s endorsement of ted cruz is no surprise as both politicians have built their careers obsessing over a social agenda rather than focusing on economic issues most important to hoosiers after mike pence signed the embarrassing and unnecessary rfra law that could cost our state million and will continue to scare jobs away from indiana ted cruz supported the governor and advocated that the federal government adopt a similar law mike pence signed one of the most restrictive abortion laws in the nation ted cruz has said rape victims should be forced to carry pregnancies to term ted cruz has campaigned for president on an extremist divisive ideology and mike pence has put that same extreme ideology into practice causing indiana to fall behind the rest of the nation this endorsement may grab headlines but mike pence has said he would vote for whoever is the republican nominee â even if itâ s donald trump â â indiana democratic party chair john zody
it is looking like we will have potus in miami on friday june rd please let the chair know and we will have more details confirmation in the am sent from my iphone

sub: RE: For approval: VPOTUS emails for 5/23
body: looks greathi folks a few of these to send from the vice president next week to kick off our monthly fundraising deadline push let me know if you have any flags and thanks v ejb you ve been by barack s and my side through so much name and if our time in office has been a lesson in anything it s that there is no magic wand you can wave to make all the change you want to see happen overnight our system wasn t designed that way the things worth doing making health care affordable acting on climate change giving folks a shot to get ahead through education and jobs take work they take struggle and compromise governing isn t easy what s easy is getting riled up blaming the other side or scapegoating groups who don t have as loud a voice to fight back lt link gt the next six months won t be easy name they re going to require each and every one of us stepping up not taking anything for granted and working as hard as we ever have to elect democrats this november lt link gt walking away from all the hard work we ve done over these past seven and a half years is unacceptable plain and simple the american people have worked too hard and come too far to go back the way republicans would take us we re not going to let that happen but we need to make sure democrats up and down the ballot all across the country have every resource they need to fight harder work smarter and win the day on november th so if you can name pitch in or more before our end of month deadline to help us get there linksthanks so much for playing your part here name i really mean it joe v sk for the next few months you re gonna hear a whole lot about red states and blue states and purple states as the pundits try to predict how this election will play out but here s the truth name we need to elect democrats up and down the ballot in every corner of the country on election day lt link gt and that means we can t take any state for granted lt link gt we ve got to use every moment between now and november th to reach as many voters as we can from maine to hawaii that means we need to get organized everywhere right now so i m calling on you to help out the only folks who are committed to electing democrats up and down the ballot in all states by pitching in or more before the dnc s end of may deadline linksthank you name i really appreciate your support joe v friend this election comes down to three simple things we ve got to elect a democratic president we just have to because we ve seen who the alternative is because we know that no president can do everything alone we have to get more democrats in congress who will work with them and this year we have a great opportunity to take back our majority in the senate and make serious gains in the house there are so many important decisions that are being made in our statehouses from funding for women s health services to protecting the rights of our lgbt neighbors so we ve got to elect democratic governors and legislators in state and all across the country name the democratic national committee is the only official democratic party organization that is committed to all three to electing democrats in every state at every level of office so before the deadline at the end of this month i m asking you to support them with a donation of or more can you step up linkthanks name joe

body: great thanks all date thursday may at pmlooks fine to me thanks goodone changewe are recruiting for positions we know the coordinateds will need in the states and some of them we may hire sent from my iphonewill these positions be on both dnc and state party payroll plus ben for his review as well graham m wilson thanks eric vx sk friend over the next few months republicans are going to spend hundreds of millions of dollars to elect their candidates and weâ re going to beat them the same way we always have by hitting the pavement to talk with folks directly lt link gt that s why the dnc is currently looking field organizers to help elect democrats in key battlegrounds states around the country interested name alt for forwarders know someone who might be interested name lt link gt field organizers are the heart and soul of winning campaigns theyâ re the people hitting the streets to talk with their neighbors create personal connections establish relationships and build the team of democrats that is dedicated to electing our candidates and making sure america keeps moving forward together our field organizers and their volunteers will knock on every door make sure every person who wants to vote is registered and get out every vote weâ ll need to win on election day direct ask if that sounds like you then we need you on our team apply to be a field organizer right now linkforward ask we bet that sounds like someone you know if it does please forward this email to them and have them apply right away linkthank you for doing this name all the best amyamy k daceychief executive officerdemocratic national committee

sub: Fw: PRIVATE MESSAGE, REF: CONVENTION EVENT IDEA - REQUEST A "FACT SHEET" TO BE ISSUED FROM THE DNC - ASAP
body: to jordan and claire please see sen gillibrand s positive response to the convention idea co hosted by wlf off the sidelines and hopefully ahmal amp george clooney kirsten g is willing to move forward and based on the original response from the clooneys thru our mutual friend jae kim we think there s a real chance it can happen with allâ principals taking part â to do â please assembleâ a fact sheet on the event from the dnc including all detailsâ known at this time note â ref timing carol amp i spoke with emily berman and stefanie conahan kirsten s staff today and based on kirsten s convention schedule we would need to have the eventâ wednesday not tuesday approximately am noon so as to avoid the emily s list event that afternoon at pm â that is the only change from what was originally outlined not yet knowing the clooneys schedule of course we look forward to hearing from you asap thanks cynthia and carol forwarded message cynthiathanks for the great idea â i don t get to the convention until later tuesday night but emily and stefanie will work with you on timing and other arrangements â can t wait â kirsten gillibrandâ hello kirsten i hope all s well with you even with the current tumultuous political landscape surrounding us allâ carol pensky and iâ send you our warm personal wishes withâ this message onâ a conference callâ with the dncâ last week concerning ideas for wlf s presence at the philadelphiaâ convention weâ all discussed the importance of wlf â andâ also of off the sidelines â being highlighted there during a prime daytime slot â we also thought it should not beâ thru a fundraising event trusting that your plans are still open for the convention we would like to propose holding a joint event with ots and wlf possibly a festive reception to be underwritten by a woman s magazine or other suitable sponsor tuesday afternoon july th pm â we would focus on you as the special starâ attraction of this event â the idea makes complete sense to us since you are the member of congress who has done the absolute most for democratic women candidates the past several cycles â the event would give you a platform to highlight your efforts as well as include a wlf message pointing out the importance of women s involvement in the democratic party and serving as the women s host for the dnc fyi emily s list and emerge are also holding gatherings that week emily on wednesday â pm and emerge on tuesday â pm note since drafting the above paragraphs last friday a new importantâ potential scenario developed over the weekend concerning the interest and availability of amahl and george clooney in joining this event â â amahl and george said theyâ met you â were most impressed with you as a senator and a leader and would enjoy being associated with you at the convention as well the above info came back to me over the weekendâ from jae kim a former new york wlf and wlfn member who now lives in vancouver â jae has been best friendsâ with amahl for years bridesmaid at her wedding etc jae is alsoâ a good friend of mine someone i mentored in the years she lived in nyc â while discussing wlf s convention plans with jae last friday i mentioned theâ wlf ots idea â then we digressed to the possibility of the clooneys attending the convention â as a result she asked if it wasâ acceptableâ to call amahlâ and george over the weekendâ to see whether they were attending the convention mention the possibility of ots and wlf joining together that week and see what their plans were jae spoke to them saturday andâ as a result theyâ suggested the following george clooneyâ has been invited to speak at the convention hasn tâ accepted yet but feels it s very importantâ this year and is tending toward accepting andâ if he does accept thenâ bothâ of them would like to do a joint event with you ots and wlf â jae explained the importance of wlf s role in organizing women thru the democratic party and amahl and george quickly agreed with the idea i have asked the dnc to prepare a fact sheet about the potential event to be emailed to you and to the clooney s personal assistant this week finally carol and i realize we have taken a special friend advantageâ by contacting you directly indeed you are a special friend and it will be followed up byâ the official invitation from the dnc chair after our informal exploration of these ideas â we hope this plan holds a great appeal to you as well we think it would make a big impression on women at the convention and beyond and we look forward to hearing from you â thanks kirsten with all best wishes cynthia and carolcynthiafriedman yahoo com mobilecarol penskycarolpensky gmail com mobileâ

sub: Re: For approval: FLOTUS for next week
body: goodhi folks â a few of these to send from the first lady later next week let me know if you have any flags and thanks â v ejb â itâ s graduation season name these past few weeks students from all over the country have had a chance to celebrate their accomplishments and reflect back on how far theyâ ve come over the last few years this year barack gave the commencement address at howard university right here in d c he joked that he really felt old realizing the young people receiving their diplomas that day were just starting high school when he first became president thatâ s pretty incredible to think about we have come so far these past seven and a half years and so much of that work was on behalf of these young people who are going out into the world from immediate concerns like health insurance to student loan repayment to bigger picture issues like the threat of climate change just look at how far weâ ve come and name we wouldnâ t have gotten here without the support of folks like you each step of the way iâ m truly in awe of all that we accomplished together but iâ m also mindful of all the what remains to be done so if you can pitch in or more today to help make sure we can build on this by electing democrats who share our vision for a brighter future for all americans linksthank you for all you do and the part youâ ve played in this progress having you standing here with us means more than i can say michelle alt for motherâ s day card signers p s â name your warm wishes on motherâ s day meant so much to me thank you for signing my card â v sk â friend it really means a lot whenever you support the party we all share whether youâ re volunteering your time signing your name to a petition or lt link gt chipping in a few bucks when you can to help elect democrats lt link gt with xxx days left between now and election day barack and our democratic candidates need every bit of your support because we know that those days will go by faster than you or i can imagine so today iâ m reaching out to ask you for your help alt for donors again can i count on you to pitch in or more to support democrats linksas always name thank you michelle alt for motherâ s day card signers p s name i also want to take a moment to thank you for all of your warm wishes on motherâ s day it really meant so much to hear from you v er friend weâ re headed into the part of any election that barack likes to call silly season but through all the distractions i hope you never forget that we re fighting for the american dream we re fighting to make sure that every single person in this country has the opportunity to succeed and nothing can take away from just how meaningful that work us the next major fundraising deadline of this election is coming up in just a few days i hope i can count on you to pitch in or whatever you can before then to help finish what we started together linksthank you so much michelle alt for motherâ s day card signers p s name i also want to take a moment to thank you for all of your warm wishes on motherâ s day it really meant so much to hear from you

hi all â weâ ll send this later tonight to kick yesterdayâ s potus email thanks name we know what our values are â now we just need to make sure weâ re ready to fight for them answer president obamaâ s call say youâ re in pitch in or more before our deadline on saturday link forwarded message date tue apr friend in a few months i ll be heading into the voting booth to cast my vote for the next president of the united states and like so many of you i ve spent this primary observing the candidates and the parties and what they represent and i have to say this has been a difficult period for the republicans they re trying to figure out what they re standing for whether they will be the party of building walls and surveilling neighborhoods whether they will be the party that enshrines discrimination in our laws but the good news for democrats is that we know what we believe we believe that climate change is real and that we must do something about it we believe in raising the minimum wage and that women should be paid the same as men for doing the same job we believe that our laws should reflect our heritage as a nation of immigrants we believe that all people should be treated with dignity and respect no matter their race or religion gender or sexual orientation we have two fine democratic candidates who no matter their differences share this same set of core beliefs that defines our party and in november we re going to make sure that one of them becomes our next president but first right now i need to know that you re in thanks barack obamapaid for by the democratic national committee south capitol street se washington dc and not authorized by any candidate or candidate s committee
