sub: Board of Directors Training: 5 Self-Paced CDs Covering Major Duties of Board Members.
body: to see the web version of this message click here the nonprofit board of directors training series a comprehensive self paced training tool to provide your board of directors with the knowledge and skills they need to better handle their responsibilities and work cooperatively towards your missiona productive board of directors is key to achieving your nonprofit s mission in addition to their fiduciary responsibilities board members are your representative to the community attracting volunteers publicity and most importantly fundraising dollars board members also serve administrative roles such as strategic planning and budgeting and ensure that your operations can be carried out smoothly while your board members all have impressive backgrounds they may not be familiar with the responsibilities of being a board member your task is to bring your board up to speed as quickly as possible and to make sure the entire board is aligned when it comes to the direction you want to head the nonprofit board of directors training series in five self paced cds provides new and experienced board members with the training they need to understand their role and work cohesively to accomplish their goals topics covered include board member fundamentals roles and responsibilities financial fundamentals for board members fundraising fiduciary responsibilities of board members ensuring sustainability through strategic planning and evaluations and much more five comprehensive sessions this program consists of many unique features and benefits five cd presentations with accompanying slides simple clear concise courses presentations can be used as stand alone modules or as a series you can prioritize the order in which the topics are assigned adaptable for training individuals or your board as a group presentations average minutes so they can easily fit into a busy schedule duration cds approximately minutes each price price includes cds with full audio presentation and presentation slides cds may be distributed to individual board members so that they can train on their own time presenters sandra k pfau englund attorney at law lynn ivey nonprofit management consultant linda lysakowski acfre fundraising consultantwho should attend board members and executive directors what you ll learn the nonprofit board of directors training series includes five separate cds each comprised of a full audio presentation and easy to follow presentation slides the cds may be distributed to each of your board members for independent use the following is a brief overview of the contents of each cd presentation board member fundamentals roles and responsibilitiesnonprofit organizations encompass a wide range of services missions values budgets size and scope while their purpose and how they accomplish their work varies the roles and responsibilities of their board members share many commonalities this session focuses on the obligations board members have and the opportunities to use their time and talents to lead their nonprofits to success basic roles and responsibilities of board membersunderstanding the nonprofit governance process and structurekey competencies for sharing your nonprofit s storyboard chief executive relationships financial fundamentals for board membersone of the most important roles nonprofit board members have is that of providing responsible financial oversight and ensuring adequate resources for their organization this means that each board member must understand and keep track of the budget cash flow reserves and long and short range needs and also ensure acceptable accounting practices are in place this session focuses on key aspects of safeguarding the economic engine including board and staff responsibilities and rolesdefining accounting terms and processesunderstanding basic financial reportsusing financial knowledge for operational planning and budgetingrecommendations for establishing budget guidelines priorities and goals fundraisinga key responsibility of every board member is not only participation in the organization s fundraising and related activities but also elevating such efforts in order to further the nonprofit s mission this involves developing and implementing skills relating to community involvementworking with local businesses and individual donorsidentifying fundraising sources and creating donorsevent planningstrategic fundraising methods fiduciary responsibilities of board membersboard members have broad fiduciary responsibilities to the organization and its beneficiaries a comprehensive understanding of such duties is paramount to ensuring that sound practices are in place examples of the topics that are covered include duty of care duty of loyalty and duty of obedienceadherence to applicable lawsdirector and officer liability insurancepolicy developmentimplementing effective internal controls ensuring sustainability through strategic planning and evaluationsnonprofit board members are responsible for setting the strategic direction for their organization and ensuring that the activities carried out support and advance the mission effective strategic planning requires timely and accurate information as to what the organization is doing well and what needs attention planning and evaluation is not an annual event for successful nonprofits instead it is woven into its ongoing governance activities this session examines core competencies necessary to fulfill these responsibilities including understanding the value of a strong mission and purposehow to develop the organization s roadmap to successwhat strategic planning is and why it is criticalthe importance of evaluation as part of the strategic planning processstrategies for choosing performance measures that provide you with the information needed to make decisions your conference leader the nonprofit board of directors training series is conducted by three highly qualified professionals with decades providing management services to nonprofit organizations across the country sandra sandy pfau englund is the founder and managing partner of pfau englund nonprofit law p c in addition to being an attorney with more than years experience assisting nonprofit organizations in a wide range of areas she has also served as a manager of an international nonprofit organization ms englund has authored a number of articles relating to various nonprofit management topics and is a sought after speaker she earned a master s degree in public administration with a concentration in association management from george washington university washington d c and her j d degree from george washington university lynn ivey is a consultant to nonprofit organizations her nonprofit experience spans more than years and includes prior nonprofit positions with healthcare education and family support intervention programs her roles have been diverse including that of the administrator of one of south carolina s largest nonprofit hospice programs in addition she has held a variety of other nonprofit positions including director and coordinator of volunteer programs personnel manager social worker and preschool director ms ivey holds licenses as a social worker and long term care administrator because of her wealth of first hand experience both in senior nonprofit executive and volunteer positions ms ivey is a sought after speaker and has presented at many national and state conferences and regional meetings she has also served as a clinical instructor and staff trainer and has a wealth of experience as a volunteer her volunteer experiences include women s shelters a theater company u s navy family service center and scouting most recently she has held volunteer positions serving on the national council of hospice and palliative professionals ceo steering committee south carolina department of health and environmental control cancer control advisory committee south carolina association of residential care homes board of directors to mention only a few linda lysakowski acfre is one of just over one hundred professionals worldwide to hold the advanced certified fund raising executive designation in her thirty years in the development field she has managed capital campaigns helped dozens of nonprofit organizations achieve their development goals and has trained more than professionals in mexico canada egypt bermuda and most of the fifty united states linda is a graduate of alvernia college in reading pa with majors in banking and finance communications and theology philosophy she is a graduate of afp s faculty training academy and has received two afp research grants she is also a prolific writer having authored more than a dozen books and is currently working on several more books she serves as acquisitions editor for charitychannel press and for the genius press linda has received the outstanding fundraising executive award from the eastern pa las vegas and sierra nv chapters of afp association of fundraising professionals and was recognized internationally with the barbara marion award for outstanding service to afp she was honored in november with the lifetime achievement award from the las vegas chapter of afp nonprofitwebadvisor quality commitment nonprofitwebadvisor wants you to be satisfied with your webinar if this webinar does not meet your expectations email us atâ service nonprofitwebadvisor com mailto service nonprofitwebadvisor com certificate of participation certificates of participation are available to everyone attending this webinar nonprofit update more complimentary newsletter nonprofit professionals across the country rely on this need to know information resource thank you for reading this nonprofitwebadvisor advertisement copyright â nonprofitwebadvisor com all rights reserved â â â â â â s mopac expressway â â â barton oaks plaza v suite â â â austin texas â â â service nonprofitwebadvisor com mailto service nonprofitwebadvisor comclick here or email us at our service accountservice nonprofitwebadvisor com mailto service nonprofitwebadvisor comuse this link to unsubscribe

sub: BREAKING NEWS: Trump wins West Virginia Republican primary
body: donald trump has won the west virginia republican primary according to three separate news networks though he is the only candidate left running on the republican side of the race trump rallied supporters in charleston last thursday while there trump laid into democratic front runner hillary clinton for her comments in march that she would work to put a lot of coal miners and coal companies out of business west virginia elects its delegates directly on the primary ballot

sub: The Daily 202: Down-ballot women hope to ride the Hillary Clinton train in todayâ€™s Acela Primary
body: the daily from powerpostwhat to watch in md pa de ct and riâ â if you re having trouble reading this â click here lt view url gt hillary clinton held a pre election rally last nightâ at city hall park in philadelphia â photo by melina mara the washington post the big idea â pennsylvania is notoriously inhospitable to women politicians but both hillary clinton and katie mcginty are considered the favorites to win primaries here today positioning them to possibly shatter significant glass ceilings come november philadelphiaâ arlen specter came off as badly if not worse than any other senator during the clarence thomas confirmation hearings the way he pilloried anita hill from his perch of authority on the senate judiciary committee helped lead to â the year of the womanâ in california washington and illinois elected female senators in pennsylvania lynn yeakel â the daughter of a former congressman â was able to capture the democratic nod in a primary but she narrowly lost to specter that was the last time either major party in pennsylvania nominated a woman for senate or governor today all members of the commonwealthâ s congressional delegation are men â all women candidates have different expectations placed upon them â said dana brown executive director of the nonpartisan pennsylvania center for women and politics â one of the greatest challenges that women have running in pennsylvania is the incumbency advantage we have a long history of incumbents winning time and again â supporters watch hillary speak at city hall park in philadelphia last night â photo by melina mara the washington post clintonâ s big win in new york last week seems to have given her some meaningful momentum hillaryâ s coattails might help other female candidates down ballot mcginty ran for governor in and finished fourth in the democratic primary the man who won tom wolf hired her as his chief of staff she was then recruited by national democrats to take on joe sestak the retired admiral and former congressman toppled specter in a democratic primary after the now deceased senator switched parties party leaders believe sestak would once again lose to republican sen pat toomey in a general election mcginty is getting heavy support from president obama emilyâ s list and the democratic senatorial campaign committee katie mcgintyâ photo by bill clark cq roll call mcginty is a strong supporter of clinton she worked on environmental issues in the clinton administration and her messaging closely echoes hillaryâ s both are running as progressive pragmatists who wonâ t let the perfect be the enemy of the good and can break through gridlock each talks a great deal about â breaking down barriers â clinton could also be a factor in maryland both clinton and democratic senate candidate donna edwards an african american single mother received points greater support among likely women voters than male voters in a washington post poll conducted earlier this month clinton got percent among women vs percent among men while edwards got percent among women vs percent among men per pollster scott clement state sen jamie raskin was the early front runner to pick up the house seat in montgomery county that belongs to the other senate candidate chris van hollen but an influx of suburban female voters in a fractured field may give it to kathleen matthews a former marriott executive and msnbc host chris matthewsâ s wife a third candidate wine store owner david trone has spent more than million on ads barbara mikulski center left is neutralâ in the primary at aâ maryland democratic party reception in her honor last fall â that s donna edwards on the right photo by bill o leary the washington post maryland could be the only state currently represented by a woman in the senate that will no longer be next year the dean of congressional women barbara mikulski is retiring after years she was the first democratic woman elected to the senate in her own right the demographics would seem to favor edwards over van hollen but he seems to have gotten the upper hand over the past few weeks in what remains a tight and fluid race martin oâ malley yesterday joined nancy pelosi and harry reid in supporting cvh as heâ s known senate women are making gains elsewhere the democratic favorite to succeed the retiring harry reid is former nevada attorney general catherine cortez masto barbara boxer will almost certainly be succeeded by kamala harris or loretta sanchez in california vulnerable sen kelly ayotte is being challenged by new hampshireâ s female governor maggie hassan bernie sanders campaigns yesterdayâ in hartford connecticut â reuters mike segar here are other things to watch as returns come in todayâ four closed primaries work against bernie â throughout the race sanders has performed far better in states that allow independent voters to participate in their democratic primaries only one of the five on the calendar on tuesday rhode island falls into that category clinton has routinely outpaced sanders among registered democrats while sanders â cleans up with unaffiliated voters â wagner adds trump rallies in wilkes barre pennsylvania yesterday reuters brendan mcdermid donald trump is poised to sweep all five states today but how many delegates will he get â depending on results rhode island and connecticut could end up awarding delegates to a mix of contenders while the final results from pennsylvania may not be known until votes are cast on the convention floor â ed oâ keefe reports here is edâ s state by state breakdown of how it works pa the at large delegates all go to the winner of the state the congressional district delegates are directly elected by voters and are officially unbound to a candidate winners do not need to announce their intentions but in most cases the candidates have said theyâ ll vote for whoever wins their district md like pennsylvania the maryland delegates from the congressional districts are also directly elected but they must vote for the winner in their congressional district the at large delegates will be chosen at the maryland republican state convention on may and de is winner take all ct a candidate gets all at large and the rnc leader delegates if he wins a majority statewide if not delegates are doled out proportionally to candidates getting at least percent congressional district delegates are awarded to whoever wins the district ri this is an open primary â independents can participate itâ s also proportional for anyone who gets more than percent which means all three candidates should get some delegates john kasichâ uses a cell phone as a prop to make a point about how technology has changed the way of life in the united states during a rally yesterday in rockville maryland â photo by michael s williamson the washington post how many states will john kasich finish second in it is harder and harder for ted cruz to say that heâ s in a two way race with trump each time he finishes third behind the ohio governor as he did in new york last week a few of these mid atlantic states fit kasichâ s politics better than cruzâ s he may not come away with a ton of delegates or a win but it will give him an added rationale to fight on through the convention in cleveland before every previous election including the march primary in his home state of ohio kasich was pretty far down the list of candidates getting buzzed about on social media yesterday however our analytics partners at zignal labs relay thatâ he was second only to trump in total mentions to be sure some of this might be a result of the front runner attacking him over his pact with cruz â will any congressional incumbents go down despite the outsider anti establishment mood in both parties no sitting member has lost a primary yet this year two pennsylvanians are vulnerable today rep chaka fattah an term democrat is going on trial in the coming weeks for criminal counts from bribery to racketeering and mail fraud related to his run for mayor of philadelphia this has obviously made him vulnerable â but he faces three primary challengers so may be able to win with a plurality chaka fattahâ ap photo matt rourke file welcome to the daily powerpost s morning newsletter get smart fast â â more on the republican race cruz and kasich beforeâ the last republican debateâ epa cristobal herrera â the tumult did nothing to soothe the worries of voters and republican elites who worryâ that cruz and kasich have handed trump a â ready made argumentâ that the establishment is plotting against him and trump said as much in a series of stump speeches tuesday â honestly it shows such total weakness and itâ s pathetic when two longtime insider politicians â have to collude have to get together to try to beat a guy that really speaks what the people want trump rivals teaming up shows how weak they are carly fiorinaâ stumps for cruz in philly last week â michael robinson chavez the washington post from cruz s manager more on the democratic race clinton in philadelphia last nightâ melina mara the washington post the number ofâ millenialsâ who agreed that basic health insurance is a right for all people increased from percent in to percent in the survey released monday the share who agreed that basic necessities such as food and shelter are a right that government should provide to those unable to afford them increased from percent last year to percent and those who agreed that the government should spend more to reduce poverty increased from â to percent supporters scream their excitement at president obama as he works the rope line during a campaign event in richmond va on thursday october photo by nikki kahn the washington post wapo highlights polling roundup only sanders and kasich haveâ unfavorable ratings below percent with sanders at percent and kasich atâ percent butâ majoritiesâ of voters also say they would not consider voting for eitherâ of them obamaâ s job approval rating roseâ above percent for the first timeâ since a battleground poll in social media speed read social media was still joking about the kasich cruz deal ted cruz and john kasichsanders said his supporters might not listen if he backs clinton clinton allies were angry cruz and his daughters enjoyed ice cream on the campaign trail amal clooney met with ben cardin sen thom tillisâ r n c â sponspored a chili cook off sen heidi heitkampâ d n d â threw out a miss congeniality â joke bryce harper spent the day at the natural history museum hot on the left â â hot on the right â daybook for planning purposes we expect exit polling from pennsylvania connecticut and maryland on the campaign trail here s the rundown clinton hammond mishawaka ind philadelphia pa sanders huntington w va trump new york n y cruz knightstown ind at the white house president obama has no public events scheduled vice president biden holds meetings with georgian prime minister giorgi kvirikashvili and inter american development bank president luis alberto moreno in the afternoon biden administers the ceremonial swearing in of secretary of education john king on capitol hill the senate meets at a m to work on the energy bill the house meets at p m for legislative business with suspension votes expected around p m quote of the day news you can use if you live in d c videos of the day the most painful to watch moment on the campaign trail yesterday cameâ when sen tom carper d del tried to get a crowd at a hillary rally in wilmington to sing along to donna summer sâ song she works hard for the money dem senator leads clinton crowd in rendition of â she works hard for the moneyâ so that version does not get stuck in your head here is summer performing the originalâ version on johnny carson s show donna summer she works hard for the money live mpgcollege humor poked fun at sanders supporters trying to figure out his path forward why bernie sanders is actually winningis captain kirk a republican or a democrat here s william shatner s answer we asked william shatner what his hopes and fears for the future wereelton john paid tribute to prince elton john prince tribute at vegas show you re a purple warrior watch a sinkhole open up in the middle of a chinese street during rush hour sinkhole opens up in the middle of a chinese street during rush houra woman in youngstownâ painted her property red white and blue to drum up support for trump ahead of pennsylvaniaâ s primary i needed to make a statement she said â watch a two minute video of her talking about it why this pennsylvania mom painted her house red white amp blueâ the washington post â â k st nw washington dc â â

sub: BREAKING NEWS: Keyser falls short of Colorado Senate ballot
body: former state rep jon keyser failed to qualify for the republican senate primary in colorado the state s chief elections official said monday keyser has been considered a leading candidate to take on democratic sen michael bennet after encouragement from top republicans in washington and colorado as well as donors from around the country keyser submitted petition signatures to the secretary of state s office which began a line by line review of the signatures colorado secretary of state wayne williams said in a statement which said keyser fell signatures short of that were deemed valid his campaign has five days to protest the decision

sub: POLITICO's Morning Defense: Taliban could see succession struggle â€” No big Vietnam arms deals on the horizon â€” Senate tackles defense bills
body: by jeremy herb am edtwith louis nelson connor o brien and austin wrightnow the aftermath taliban could see succession struggle after leader s death the wall street journal reports on the fallout from the killing of the taliban leader the death of taliban leader mullah akhtar mansour could accelerate the breakup of a movement that ruled afghanistan and gave sanctuary to al qaeda before a u s led invasion drove it from power in mullah mansour about was killed in a u s drone strike over the weekend in southwestern pakistan near the border with afghanistan president barack obama confirmed monday but in a reflection of its disarray the taliban still wasn t corroborating their leader s death a breakaway faction however quickly declared the deceased mullah mansour a puppet and vowed to fight whoever succeeded him in his announcement monday those seen as the most likely to now take over the taliban are considered even less inclined than mullah mansour to reconcile with a u s backed government they have fought for years some observers fear the further splintering of the group could fuel further violence as taliban factions fight to assert control over some regions of the country taliban meet to talk successor determine how mansour was targeted by drone writes reuters while the taliban have yet to confirm the death of their leader saturday in a remote area in pakistan near the border with afghanistan senior members of the insurgency s leadership council met to begin choosing mansour s successor the taliban have set up a member commission to try to establish how mansour was targeted by the u s drones sources within the group said after mansour strike military wants more leeway in taliban fight via the wsj the death of the taliban s leader in a u s drone strike has scrambled discussions between the u s military and the white house over whether to let u s forces once again conduct offensive operations against the insurgent group in afghanistan the american military wants presidential permission to use airpower to blunt the group s threatened advances this summer according to several u s officials the white house first wants to see what effect the death of mullah akhtar mansour in pakistan over the weekend will have on the taliban senior administration officials said obama in vietnam arms ban is lifted but big ticket items aren t on the horizon reports our colleague austin wright the vietnamese air force won t be flying the most advanced u s fighter jets anytime soon president barack obama s just announced decision to fully lift the decades old ban on lethal arms sales to vietnam is a symbolically important step that analysts say could lead to more sales of maritime security equipment to the country which has tangled with china over claims to islands in the south china sea but there are several factors that will likely prevent vietnam from buying more advanced offensive military equipment in the near future analysts say the first is the fact that some members of congress continue to have concerns about the country s human rights record and congress has a lot of say over foreign arms deals the second obstacle is that vietnam s military has a limited defense budget and likely can t afford the most advanced u s military equipment obama calls for peaceful resolution in south china sea via cnn president barack obama called for the peaceful resolution of disputes in the south china sea in a speech in hanoi in the south china sea the u s is not a claimant in current disputes but we will stand with our partners in upholding key principles like freedom of navigation obama said tuesday happy tuesday and welcome to morning defense where we re always on the lookout for tips pitches and feedback email us at jherb politico com and follow on twitter jeremyherb morningdefense and politicopro happening today senate inches forward on ndaa the senate started its shall we say methodical work on the national defense authorization act on monday as democrats blocked an attempt to quickly bring bill to the floor senate armed services chairman john mccain made a motion to immediately take up the bill but senate minority leader harry reid objected blocking it from moving forward instead majority leader mitch mcconnell filed a motion to formally begin debate which likely won t come up for a vote until wednesday the procedural dust up means that barring an agreement among republicans and democrats on timing and amendments the senate is unlikely finish the bill bye weeklong memorial day recess the goal of some republican leaders on the senate floor mccain argued growing world threats require lawmakers to act as quickly as possible to enact the must pass measure but reid countered that bills like the ndaa take a long time and expressed concern that mccain planned to offer an amendment to increase defense funding without addressing limits on domestic spending meanwhile the senate defense appropriations subcommittee takes up its defense spending bill ahead of thursday s full committee markup the committee is expected to release a summary of the bill today and the full bill text and committee report will come later in the week and the senate s ndaa committee report released monday is here the ndaa amendments begin the senate amendments on the ndaa are beginning to roll in with filed by monday evening some highlights include sen rand paul r ky seeking to repeal the selective service and declassify the pages of the report sen jerry moran r kan calling to increase army and marine corps end strength and toughen the restrictions on transferring guantanamo detainees and sen heidi heitkamp d n d seeking to ensure b b and b bombers are modernized in the event the b long range strike bomber is canceled gillibrand again presses sexual assault legislation sens kirsten gillibrand d n y and chuck grassley r iowa hold a joint press conference this morning on gillibrand s legislation to take the decision to prosecute most criminal cases outside the military s chain of command the new york democrat is expected to offer her bill as an amendment to the defense policy bill and she s citing recent reports that the military s arguments for commanders to prosecute cases were misleading the senate defeated her bill on procedural motions in and last year in both cases votes were needed to proceed also today stimson report on war funding the stimson center is out with a report today on the long term effects of relying on overseas contingency operations funds warning the continued use of the emergency funding threatens national security the report calls for a plan to wind down oco funding beginning with the expiration of the bipartisan budget act in fiscal stimson is holding a forum this afternoon on the report s release with a panel discussion including former pentagon comptroller robert hale and report author laicie heeley heeley told morning d that the latest gambit from house armed services chairman mac thornberry r texas and house appropriators to fund the pentagon s war budget only partially through the year is a particularly egregious example of misusing oco thornberry and others have argued that the military faces a readiness crisis if so this is the last way we should be addressing it she said up in connecticut defense secretary ash carter visits the general dynamics electric boat facility in groton and the naval submarine base new london sen tim kaine d va speaks at the center for strategic and international studies on next steps for u s cybersecurity and sen barbara boxer d calif testifies on female veterans suicide prevention legislation in the senate veterans affairs committeewar report iraqi leader cites early successes in fallujah push via the ap iraq s prime minister hailed big successes monday by government troops after launching an offensive to retake fallujah from islamic state militants but the operation promises to be one of the toughest challenges yet for the country s struggling security forces troops recaptured some agricultural areas in garma a district along the northeastern edge of fallujah under intensified iraqi airstrikes and heavy artillery said col mahmoud al mardhi who leads shiite militia forces in the operation bombings in syria nearly killed in government controlled territory the new york times has more on monday s attacks here two teams of suicide attackers waged coordinated assaults on monday deep inside syrian government territory killing scores of people and piercing a sanctuary for supporters of president bashar al assad merely pulling off the bombings was a logistical feat that calls into question the effectiveness of syria s defenses to reach the areas attacked the jihadists would have had to move large quantities of explosives and a group of militants across more than miles of government controlled territory without being detected suggesting a major security breach speed read the u s decision to target the taliban leader with a drone strike is seen as a message to pakistan which was not notified beforehand nyt the pakistani foreign office summons u s ambassador david hale to express concern over the drone strike that killed the taliban leader the washington post the obama administration says russia has a special responsibility to stop the bombings in syria but the russians don t appear to be listening politico joint chiefs chairman gen joe dunford rejects the notion the pentagon is putting band aids on the problems the islamic state poses in iraq the washington post the iraqi army s campaign to retake fallujah from the islamic state isn t likely to include the help of ground level u s military advisers military times vietnam war veteran and purple heart recipient secretary of state john kerry gets a warm welcome in hanoi the washington post the eu agrees to help rebuild the libyan navy to combat human trafficking in the mediterranean sea reuters va secretary robert mcdonald is slammed by republicans after he compares va wait times to lines at disneyland stars and stripes outgoing u s africa command chief army gen david rodriguez criticizes the outsize attention given to unilateral strikes carried out by his command stars and stripes senate foreign relations chairman bob corker r tenn declined an invitation to join obama in asia but he found time to meet with donald trump stoking vp speculation politico the zumwalt class destroyer is one of the navy s most conspicuous ships and among its least understood u s naval instituteto view online

sub: POLITICO Breaking News: Bernie Sanders wins Oregon Democratic primary
body: bernie sanders has won the oregon democratic primary according to the associated press sanders trailed hillary clinton in recent polling conducted in the state though the vermont senator s campaign had long been bullish on his chances in the pacific northwest given his strong performance in the washington state caucus oregon awards its pledged delegates on a proportional basis

body: looks fine to me thanks goodone changewe are recruiting for positions we know the coordinateds will need in the states and some of them we may hire sent from my iphonewill these positions be on both dnc and state party payroll plus ben for his review as well graham m wilson thanks eric vx sk friend over the next few months republicans are going to spend hundreds of millions of dollars to elect their candidates and weâ re going to beat them the same way we always have by hitting the pavement to talk with folks directly lt link gt that s why the dnc is currently looking field organizers to help elect democrats in key battlegrounds states around the country interested name alt for forwarders know someone who might be interested name lt link gt field organizers are the heart and soul of winning campaigns theyâ re the people hitting the streets to talk with their neighbors create personal connections establish relationships and build the team of democrats that is dedicated to electing our candidates and making sure america keeps moving forward together our field organizers and their volunteers will knock on every door make sure every person who wants to vote is registered and get out every vote weâ ll need to win on election day direct ask if that sounds like you then we need you on our team apply to be a field organizer right now linkforward ask we bet that sounds like someone you know if it does please forward this email to them and have them apply right away linkthank you for doing this name all the best amyamy k daceychief executive officerdemocratic national committee

sub: The Daily 202: Failure of Burlington College is a big problem for Bernie and Jane Sanders
body: the daily from powerpostschool blames land deal made by senatorâ s wife as it goes belly upâ â if you re having trouble reading this â click here lt view url gt bernie and jane sanders wave goodbye to a crowd in manhattan last month â photo by yana paskova for the washington post the big idea â burlington college is feeling the burn bernie sanders is huge on college campusesâ or yuuuuge as he likes to sayâ but the small private school in vermont that his wife jane ran for seven years announced yesterday that it will shutter because of â the crushing weightâ of debt incurred under her leadership jane sanders joins her husbandâ at a rally last weekâ in atlantic city â ap photo mel evans mrs sanders has become an increasingly prominent figure in her husbandâ s campaign the onetime community activist routinely travels with him and has become a ubiquitous surrogate on cable tv the failure of burlington college gives credence to two arguments routinely made by the clinton campaign and its allies first bernie and jane were insufficiently vetted by the mainstream media many reporters have passed on writing up opposition research hits about the vermont senator or focusing on the problems at the college because they did not believe he ever had any realistic chance of being the nominee the clintons owing to their status as the front runners and former occupants of the white house have continued to command a more intense level of scrutiny the sanders campaign has ignored repeated requests for comment on burlington collegeâ s failure the uncharacteristic silence is telling the campus of burlington college in vermontâ ap photo wilson ring this morningâ s clips are brutal for the sanders campaign especially on the day of two must win primaries welcome to the daily powerpost s morning newsletter while you were sleeping two national polls that came off embargo at a m show good news for trumpâ marco rubio shows upâ for a senate foreign relations committee hearing ap photo andrew harnik marco rubio turns media critic from p m to a m rubio tweeted responses highlights the upshot of the tweet storm seems to be that rubio believes he can run for president in without holding elected office heâ s almost certainly referring to ronald reagan whose term as governor of california ended in and then ran for president as a private citizen in both and john edwards who left the senate after â tried it in with less successâ the senator had tweeted little since dropping out of the presidential race in march then on saturday he criticized nbcâ s today show for shadowing him on a tour of a hud project in florida only to ask him about â polls and trump â but he couldnâ t have disliked the piece that much he linked to it get smart fast â â glenn grothman then a wisconsin state senator in photo by matt mcclain the washington post trump at trump tower reuters lucas jackson can trump change fabrizio for his part â used toâ mockâ trump on twitter before he went on his payroll the fundraising imbalance between clinton and trump is acute â the top three super pacs supporting clinton had collected about million through the end of march compared with just million by several potential republican presidential players â gop infighting has hampered efforts to build a credible money machine â â two rival super pacs are in the mix but both are newly formed and are viewed with skepticism by major donors and their advisers the free for all environment alarms theâ strategists who have signed on to helpâ trump â â the lack of a major super pac vehicle is a source of concern among top trump advisers some of whom have contacted experienced strategists in recent weeks to gauge their interest in launching a new entity such outreach is potentially risky since federal law prohibits a candidateâ s agent from establishing a super pac â â when asked if he was aware of such talks trump campaign manager corey lewandowski wrote in an email â mr trump continues to disavow all super pacâ s â matea notes that thisâ unequivocal statement will probably further confuse major donors who interpreted trumpâ s softening rhetoric on super pacsâ as a sign that he was open to their support the daughters and wife of john kasich react as he announces the end of his campaign two weeks ago primaries today in kentucky and oregonâ democratic delegates are on the line in or in ky hillary speaks to voters in bowling green yesterday â melina mara the washington post now the question is what the new registrations will add up to the most recent polling in the state showed clinton widely leading sanders with percent to his percent per portland based dhm research â even when the firm ran the numbers with higher turnout among young and new voters two target audiences for sanders clinton was still up by points outside the margin of error of percentage points â while clinton continues to struggle because of her promise gaffe to put a lot of coal miners out of work her campaign has begun to reach out to kentuckyâ s small but reliable african american voting population â african americans make up more than percent of the population in vote rich cities such as louisville in jefferson county unlike eight years ago when clinton lost the county to barack obama she could show unexpected strength against sanders in one of the stateâ s liberal enclaves â kentucky strategist dale emmons said he expects turnout to be â modest at bestâ due to primary season fatigue â low turnout elections will often hand you surprises â he said clinton said at a diner yesterday â i ll tell you this i m not going to give up on kentucky in november â this is funny â whatâ s your over under for how many times she actually returns to the bluegrass state one colorful stories that befit the culture of each state tom steyer in los angeles this weekend afp getty images wapo highlights megyn kelly at fox news corporate headquarters last weekâ chris sorensen for the washington post on becoming a character in the drama â â if i could go back and undo all that followed that august th debate question i would i wouldnâ t take back the debate question â ever under any circumstances i stand by that question percent for the record it was a great question the good things that have happened to me as a result of the dust up with trump â sure i suppose you could include the vanity fair cover in there â but the truth is percent of the experience has been quite dark and unpleasant â on how she arranged for her first meeting with trump â first he said â no â then he said â yes â i had proposed coming to him wherever he was i didnâ t think it needed to be on neutral ground â she says she woke up unusually anxious not knowing what to expect â certainly i had seen what he had said about me on twitter and elsewhere but i donâ t know if we can really refer to that as communication â on whether he apologized â he didnâ t nor was an apology required or requested â we probably both knew instinctually it was better not to go there on our first meeting â because he stayed angry for so long so i not only believed he would say â no â i also believed that if he said â yesâ â it would not be a good exchange i didnâ t want to sit for some hand to hand combat i was already in the midst of that with him â on his end let me stress on his end â social media speed read â zignal visual bette middler steals the show â monday was a rare day in the race for president one of the few days when somebody tweeting about trump received more attention than trump himself monday it was bette midler who compared the presumptive gop nominee to australian hip hop artist and swaggy p fiancee azealia banks midler has about twitter followers and was retweeted more than times her post was seen by as many as million people worldwide according to zignalâ labsâ analytics theâ other top trump tweets were all from trump himself bipartisan comity after breitbart s david horowitz called weekly standard editorâ bill kristol a renegade jew in a story the phrase began trending on twitter the slur against kristolâ was widely condemned including by the anti defamation league here s how coppins responded the pushback continued this morning the washington examiner sâ byron york called the times story not particularly effective the piece is clearly breaking through perhaps because trump keeps drawing more attention to it donald also continues egging on bernie dnc chair debbie wasserman schultz seized on the story barbara boxer also went after trump and some news from the commencement circuit spotted in puerto rico bryan cranston has been hanging out in d c s e cupp jonathan franzen and chuck todd were on jeopardy rep keith ellison d minn took a selfie withâ hisâ new shades rep don beyer d va celebrated his predecessorâ jim moran s birthday and mike webb who is running as an independent against beyer d left some interesting tabs open on his facebook page foreign relations committee chairmanâ bob corker r tenn â met with kissinger cory booker snapped a photo with pages the white house kitchen garden posted this photo from the nordic state dinner hillary signed a bernie button good reads from elsewhere hot on the left â hot on the right daybook on the campaign trail sanders is in carson calif clinton and trump are off the trail at the white house vice president biden administers the ceremonial swearing in for u s ambassador to mexico roberta jacobson in the evening biden speaks at an opening performance at the kennedy center related to irish arts and culture on capitol hill three votes are expected in the senate at p m the house meets at noon for legislative business and is expected to begin consideration of the national defense authorization act quote of the day â news you can use if you live in d c videos of the day watch clinton s evolving impersonations of trump hillary clinton s evolving impressions of donald trumprachel maddow joked about trump s cabinet on late night with seth meyers rachel maddow reveals trump s cabinetjohnny depp talked about playing trump johnny depp on playing donald trump the graham norton show bbcjennifer lawrence didn t hold back in discussing her views watch jennifer lawrence s profanity laced message for donald trumpfans of mr robot check out the trailer for season two â mr robot season trailer hd â hamiltonâ creator lin manuel miranda spoke out strongly against the anti immigrant rhetoric of today s politics during his commencement address at the university of pennsylvania â immigrants get the job done â he said lin manuel miranda immigrants get the job done laura jane graceâ the lead singer of the band â against me â â burned her birth certificate on stage to protest north carolina s bathroom bill she came out as transgender in laura jane grace sets birth certificate alight at n c protest concertwatchâ buzzfeed sâ full half hourâ interview with obama which was streamed live online sub: DNC Chair Statement on Todayâ€™s Jobs Report
body: for immediate releasemay contact â dnc press lt tel gt dnc chair statement on todayâ s jobs reportwashington â dnc chair rep debbie wasserman schultz released the following statement in response to aprilâ s jobs report that showed straight months of private sector job growth an increase in average hourly earnings of so far this year and a decline in the number of long term unemployed by â aprilâ s jobs report is more proof that the hard work being done by president obama and congressional democrats to rebuild the economy after the great recession is paying off there is no denying that straight months of private sector job growth â the longest stretch on record â is progress that american workers and families can count on more importantly this monthâ s report showed a strong increase in wages which hardworking families need and deserve and a large drop in the number of long term unemployed we still have a lot of work to do to strengthen middle class and working families but itâ s clear that the economy has undergone a remarkable turnaround from where we were seven years ago â this concrete progress also offers a stark contrast to what donald trump has promised to do as president his reckless plans would hurt working families destabilize our economy and drag our country back to where we were when the last republican president left office â losing jobs a month dangerous donaldâ s real life record is already riddled with embarrassing failures and cheap schemes designed to turn a quick buck at the expense of everyday americans we cannot afford to let him do the same thing from the oval office â we need a forward looking leader in the oval office who will build on the progress weâ ve already made and who will ensure that we have an economy that works for everyone we must elect a democrat as our next president â

body: will these positions be on both dnc and state party payroll plus ben for his review as well graham m wilson thanks eric vx sk friend over the next few months republicans are going to spend hundreds of millions of dollars to elect their candidates and weâ re going to beat them the same way we always have by hitting the pavement to talk with folks directly lt link gt that s why the dnc is currently looking field organizers to help elect democrats in key battlegrounds states around the country interested name alt for forwarders know someone who might be interested name lt link gt field organizers are the heart and soul of winning campaigns theyâ re the people hitting the streets to talk with their neighbors create personal connections and build the team of democrats that is dedicated to electing our candidates and making sure america keeps moving forward together our field organizers and their volunteers will knock on every door make sure every person who wants to vote is registered and get out every vote weâ ll need to win on election day direct ask if that sounds like you then we need you on our team apply to be a field organizer right now linkforward ask we bet that sounds like someone you know if it does please forward this email to them and have them apply right away linkthank you for doing this name all the best amyamy k daceychief executive officerdemocratic national committee

sub: BREAKING NEWS: Hillary Clinton wins Maryland Democratic primary
body: hillary clinton has won the maryland democratic primary according to the associated press the former secretary of state commanded point leads over bernie sanders in recent polls including a percent to percent advantage over the vermont senator while clinton herself did not visit the state over the last week her daughter chelsea campaigned in maryland s washington d c suburbs on thursday in addition to making a stop in suburban baltimore clinton scored the endorsements of a number of statewide and local officials in maryland both past and present including sens ben cardin and barbara mikulski and the state s treasurer and comptroller maryland awards its pledged delegates on a proportional basis

sub: RE: For approval: VPOTUS emails for next week
body: two small edits thanks hi all â a few of these to send next week let me know if you have any flags and thanks â v ch friend â when i was just a kid i learned that a job was about more than just a paycheck itâ s about respect and dignity and knowing that at the end of the day working hard means having a chance to get ahead lt link gt name everyone who works hard and plays by the rules deserves to be paid fairly and itâ s up to us to make that a reality lt link gt raising the standard of living for working families is one of the most important economic issues facing folks in every corner of this country itâ s why weâ ve fought so hard together for minimum wage increases why the president is expanding overtime protections for millions of workers and why we all work to protect the rights our workers have to unionize and negotiate for a fair wage we ve got all this progress to protect and a hell of a lot more work to do to make sure weâ re creating a level playing field weâ ve got an opportunity in november to elect leaders who will fight with us to expand opportunity so that every person in this country has a chance to succeed and weâ ve got to take it name so if youâ re with me and ready to keep working for our workers then add your name and say youâ re in to do whatever it takes to win on november th linkour resilience will carry us through to some major breakthroughs for families all across this country i know we can make this happen together thanks name joe v sk friend â seventy four straight months of private sector job growth nearly million new jobs in six years more than million folks with access to affordable health care our deficit cut in half â weâ ve come an awful long way through the course of president obamaâ s time in the white house but with donald trump as the gop s presumptive nominee for president every bit of the progress that weâ ve made together these past seven years is on the line lt link gt the stakes in this election simply could not be higher lt link gt trump s values have absolutely no business anywhere near the white house but i ve gotta tell you name with republican governors and members of congress lining up behind trump there are a lot of races we need to win on election day so name you d better believe i m fired up and ready to do whatever it takes to help elect democrats up and down the ballot if you feel the same way then add your name right now donors alt then pitch in or more to help us stop donald trump right away linkthank you so much for this name joeâ vx rae â friend â i want to make something very very clear now that donald trump will be the republican nominee our voices are more important than ever we know that the more folks hear what democrats believe in the better our candidates do and thanks to the past seven years under president barack obama weâ ve seen much change we can inspire and make happen when we work together in support of those common values so i know that together we are going to beat donald trump if youâ re ready to put a democratic president in the white house this november add your name right now linksthis is important work weâ re doing so thank you name joe

daily message pointsapril president obama to travel to flint michigan today the president announced that he will travel to flint michigan where he will hear first hand from flint residents about the public health crisis receive an in person briefing on the federal efforts in place to help respond to the needs of the people of flint and deliver remarks to community members he announced his visit by replying to eight year old flint resident mari copeny known around town as little miss flint who wrote to the president to share how she is working in her community to bring attention to the public health crisis in her community the president replied writing dear mari thank you for writing to me you re right that presidents are often busy but the truth is in america there is no more important title than citizen and i am so proud of you for using your voice to speak out on behalf of the children of flint that s why i want you to be the first to know that i m coming to visit flint on may th i want to make sure people like you and your family are receiving the help you need and deserve like you i ll use my voice to call for change and help lift up your community letters from kids like you are what make me so optimistic for the future i hope to meet you next week little miss flint sincerely barack obama the u s department of health and human services hhs is coordinating efforts with federal agencies including the environmental protection agency epa federal emergency management agency fema small business administration sba the department of agriculture usda and the department of housing and urban development hud to respond to the water crisis in flint together these agencies are working to ensure that every flint resident has access to safe water and the administration is making real progress o percent of flint residents have access to bottled water and water filters o million liters of water have been provided to the state of michigan by fema plus more than water and pitcher filters and over filter replacement cartridges o percent of hud insured and hud assisted properties have water filters installed and these filters will be kept up to date o of a hud existing lead paint hazard grant for public housing in flint that can be applied to this crisis o water samples have been taken by epa from more than properties for types of tests tests have shown that filters on home faucets are removing lead tests also show the system is recovering in addition to ensuring access to clean water the administration is dedicating resources to protecting health and setting the stage for community recovery but the president knows there is more to be done in flint and across the country to do right by our citizens that s what his trip next week is all about champions of change expanding fair chance opportunity today the white house recognized ten individuals from across the country as white house champions of change for expanding fair chance opportunities these individuals were selected by the white house for their leadership and tireless work to remove barriers to a second chance for those with a criminal record this is important because each year more than individuals are released from state and federal prisons and approximately million people about one third of working age adults have an arrest or conviction too often these individuals leave prison with few resources practical skills or the support they need to successfully reintegrate into society and they end up returning to prison that s why last year the president announced new actions to help formerly incarcerated americans who have paid their debt to society successfully obtain a job find a home take care of family responsibilities and enjoy a second chance these actions are underlined by a simple belief when americans who have earned a second chance are able to put their lives back on track our communities are safer and stronger for it that s what today s event featuring remarks by senior advisor to the president valerie jarrett attorney general loretta e lynch deputy attorney general sally yates and labor deputy secretary chris lu was all about

sub: Re: Batting Practice today likely cancelled because of rain-rescheduled double header
body: hi jordan i had adam leave you the passes anyway but he said that there is no batting practice today so no one will be out on the field between games not really sure what you want to do about that but just wanted to let you know enjoyaudiesent from my iphone gt gt hi jordan gt gt my cousin audie jones adam jones wife is cc d and she just let me know that bp is likely canceled today gt gt i m connecting you two so that you can get the details gt gt i m sure your game tonight will be awesome nonetheless gt gt audie thanks again to you and adam for the offer of the passes what a gift gt gt blessings to you all gt l gt gt gt leslie lewis gt gt actor producer one taste coach gt gt to pre order the dvd of our new film gt

sub: RE: You're Invited! Jewish American Heritage Month Reception
body: feel free to send around no gentiles clayton coxregional finance directorflorida georgia amp midwestdemocratic national committeecoxc dnc org lt mailto coxc dnc org gt office cell attached is the invitation for this friday s jewish american heritage month celebration l chayim clayton coxregional finance directorflorida georgia amp midwestdemocratic national committeecoxc dnc org lt mailto coxc dnc org gt office cell dear friend i am writing to invite you to jewish american heritage month celebratory reception at the democratic national committee the reception will be may th pm and will include remarks from dnc chairwoman debbie wasserman schultz please do not hesitate to reach out to me if you have any questions i hope you can join us aaronaaron weinbergdirector of jewish engagementdemocratic national committeeweinberga dnc org lt mailto weinberga dnc org gt cell jewishamericans d

yes i have asked him for his passport i will let you know if he responds rachel rauscher the address in ngp is rue amelie carrollton tx even with a foreign address the name is too common thatâ s why in my original email i asked for a us address or more information there is no way we can track down a eduardo garcia without more information getting his us pp will help us determine if he is a citizen sorry i know this can be a pain but i want to make sure we vet the right person and heâ s a citizen thanks this is the address you all have for him right rue amelie paris frrachel rauscher sorry my bad he wasn t vetted because the info was wrong so he fails until we get the info and shouldn t go to the event i think we are all on the same page now sent from my iphoneok got it rachel rauscher if he brings it to the event that s ok too but let us know sent from my iphonei have emailed him to let him know rachel rauscher ok we need to have it before noon otherwise he wonâ t be able to attend iâ ll have to remove him from the roster rachel rauscher thanks what time is the event our time no response i will try him again rachel rauscher any update on this he canâ t attend unless we can vet thanks will do rachel rauscher hey rachel we will need more information on eduardo garcia his address in ngp is half france half american the name is too common to not have more information can we get his full american address or a copy of his us pp thanks kevin

hey don t panic great way to start an email at pm the discussion below happened and one more i m about to forward you kate suddenly thought i was sending dws into a lobbying leg session breakfast tomorrow morning which i am not doing it s going to be political gossip and a very low key breakfast holler if you want to talk alex love you but we can t do this to debbie there were no joke bills on this topic on the floor in the last two days talk to tom asap and get something pulled together for the brief every time we lean on the legislative staff to do this it is recorded and we can t have that hey there unfortunately i don t have any talking points but we were talking to our host and they re likely going to want to talk about the legislation that was on the floor today or was meant to be on the floor sorry i don t follow this stuff all too closely regarding opioid abuse and regulation they ll also be interested in talking about the zika virus there s legislation to move funds away from ebola support to address a potential zika outbreak this summer ana is opposed to this move as there s still potential for another ebola outbreak they believe that ebola and zika both warrant research and that funds should be found elsewhere to address a potential zika outbreak congressman g k butterfield will also be in attendance and sits on energy amp commerce he votes in favor of a lot of ana s priority issues so i don t see this being a tense breakfast in any way tomorrow is the last day of nurses week florence nightingale s birthday so i m sure it would also be good for her to touch on all the good and generally thankless work that nurses do let me know if you have any other questions thanks scott shapiro carla are there talking points remarks for the chairwoman to use tomorrow morning that can be uploaded i am looping sarah farhadian who will be there as well on comp time in case legislative issues come up for healthcare garret bonoskydeputy directoroffice of the chairdemocratic national committee

sub: Fwd: President Obama in Seattle on June 24
body: jordan do you want to also do a dnc event while the president is in town sonya and i would be honored to host again tomsent from my ipadbegin forwarded message date may at pm pdthello tom i wanted you to be the first to know this exciting news on friday june th president barack obama will be coming to seattle for a dinner to support my campaign you have been a wonderful supporter and i am hopeful that you will continue that support by serving as a table captain at this historic event to serve as a table captain you would sell ten seats for this exciting dinner on june th at the washington state convention center you can either recruit your friends and colleagues to purchase tickets individually or purchase the table yourself all table captains will have their names placed in a lottery to be one of the lucky individuals to have their photo taken with president obama the president s help comes at a pivotal time for my reelection i hope you will join trudi and me as we welcome president obama back to seattle for what is likely to be his last trip as president we look forward to having you join us to hear from the president as he continues to fight for economic justice and our shared progressive values here are the details friday june time dinnerwashington state convention center convention place seattlefeel free to contact us at or june jayinslee com lt mailto june jayinslee com gt if you would like to host a table or if you have any questions i am honored to welcome president obama back to washington and look forward to sharing this experience with you very truly yours jay inslee

sub: POLITICO's Morning Money, presented by Allied Progress: World freaks out over Trump â€” Markets freak out over profits â€” Dollar drops â€” Sanders lists demands
body: by ben white am edtworld freaks out over trump reuters london donald trump s first major foreign policy address alarmed american allies who view the republican front runner s repeated invocation of an america first agenda as a threat to retreat from the world while most governments were careful not to comment publicly on a speech by a u s presidential candidate germany s foreign minister veered from that protocol to express concern at trump s wording markets freak out over profits wsj s theo francis and kate linebaugh u s corporate profits weighed down by the energy slump and slowing global growth are set to decline for the third straight quarter in the longest slide in earnings since the financial crisis weakness was felt across the board with executives from apple inc to railroad norfolk southern corp and snack giant mondelez international inc saying the current quarter remains tough dollar drops bloomberg the dollar dropped against almost all of its major peers after weaker than expected u s economic growth dimmed prospects for a federal reserve interest rate increase at a time when monetary easing is being put on hold elsewhere asian stocks fell and crude oil traded near a barrel the yen was headed for its biggest weekly jump since after the bank of japan unexpectedly refrained from adding to record stimulus first quarter sucks again john hancock manulife chief economist megan greene while q gdp in the us came in below consensus at percent annualized from percent in q it also gives us little insight into how the fed might act going forward q gdp growth in the us has historically been lackluster given a number of seasonal adjustment issues and this year was no different investment plummeted by percent previously percent the worst we ve seen since this is partly owing to a relatively strong usd and a continued collapse in oil and gas drilling gop elites giving up on stopping trump wp s philip rucker throughout the republican party from new hampshire to florida to california many leaders operatives donors and activists arrived this week at the conclusion they had been hoping to thwart or at least delay donald trump will be their presidential nominee an aura of inevitability is now forming around the controversial mogul mm sidebar seems like the gop elite might want to wait until at least next tuesday night to throw in in the towel on trump the billionaire was always going to score big in northeastern blue states if ted cruz manages to win indiana on tuesday hope will remain to keep trump under delegates if trump wins the hoosier state then yeah it will be over celebrating evangelisti little birdie tells mm that joe evangelisti jpmorgan chase s chief communications officer celebrates his th anniversary at the bank today making him the longest serving pr honcho in high finance jpm ceo jamie dimon is throwing a party tonight where colleagues journalists and pr competitors will toast joe s awesomeness good friday morning amazing ot win for the caps over the pens last night fueled by a hat trick including the game winner from t j oshie still it s gonna be a long tough series the penguins are superb and the caps are good at winning game s vs the pens and going on to lose the series email me on bwhite politico com and follow me on twitter morningmoneyben this morning on politico pro financial services zachary warmbrodt with this quarter s edition of our financial services lobbying and political spending newsletter and to get morning money every day before a m please contact pro services at info politicopro com things that are weird kocherlakota edition former minnesota fed president narayana kocherlakota wrote an op ed for bloomberg on thursday suggesting that donald trump was starting to make economic sense i was glad to see trump address fed related issues in an interview with fortune magazine last week his key comments we have to rebuild the infrastructure of our country we have to rebuild our military which is being decimated by bad decisions we have to do a lot of things we have to reduce our debt and the best thing we have going now is that interest rates are so low that lots of good things can be done that aren t being done amazingly let us remember that in this same fortune interview trump said he would dump fed chair janet yellen and also criticized rates as too low and punishing savers he also did a full reversal from an interview given just a couple of weeks prior in which he pledged to wipe out the entire trillion national debt in eight years which would well it would be impossible then there is the matter of the trillion cost of his tax cut plan this is making sense aba slams fed on dividends the american bankers assoc wrote to the federal reserve voicing strong opposition to december legislation that substantially cut the dividends paid on federal reserve stock from the letter this change to the statutory dividend rate upended federal reserve system policy on offsets and incentives for system membership dating from the inception of the federal reserve in place for over years the big idea why is productivity stuck nyt s neil irwin more than million americans count themselves employed a number that has risen sharply in the last few years the question is this what are they doing all day because whatever it is it barely seems to be registering in economic output we could chalk that up to a statistical blip if it were a single year productivity data are notoriously volatile but this has been going on for some time amazon scores surprise profit leslie hook in san francisco amazon reported its most profitable quarter to date on thursday as sales beat expectations sending its share price up percent to value the group at almost bn sales grew to bn in the first quarter up percent from the same period a year ago exceeding analysts expectations and the company s own forecast net income rose to m amazon s highest quarterly profit north american retail sales and international retail sales both grew more than percent during the quarter pay disparity worsens wp s danielle paquette pay disparities between men and women start earlier in their careers than frequently assumed and have significantly widened for young workers in the past year according to a report from the economic policy institute paychecks for young female college graduates are about percent as large as those of their male peers the think tank found a serious drop from percent last year katzenberg to step down at dreamworks lat s ryan faughnder jeffrey katzenberg the hollywood mogul whose name has been synonymous with dreamworks animation will step down as chief executive after his company is sold to comcast corp s nbcuniversal after the deal closes katzenberg will become chairman of dreamworks new media made up of the company s stakes in awesomeness tv and nova nbcuniversal said thursday in addition katzenberg will serve as a consultant to nbcuniversal icymi obama talks economy president obama spoke about his economy record with andrew ross sorkin in the sunday nyt mag i actually compare our economic performance to how historically countries that have wrenching financial crises perform by that measure we probably managed this better than any large economy on earth in modern history derivatives brokers get fed access ft s gregory meyer in new york and philip stafford in london derivatives brokers choosing where to park their margin money will now have the option of the world s most powerful central bank the federal reserve bank of chicago has authorised three of the us s largest clearing houses run by cme group and intercontinental exchange and the options clearing corporation to open an account at the central bank ice s permit is for its us credit derivatives clearing house to view online
